qas.question: What has excessive hunting contributed heavily to?

answers.text: the endangerment, extirpation and extinction of many animals

qas.question: What do Steller's sea cow, the bluebuck, and the Javan tigers all have in common?
Why have poachers killed endangered animals?

answers.text: primarily for commercial sale or sport.

context: However, <a5_0>excessive hunting<a5_0/> and poachers have also <a4_0>contributed heavily<a4_0/> to <a0_0>the <a6_0>endangerment<a6_0/>, extirpation and <a1_0>extinction<a1_0/> of many animals<a0_0/>, such as the quagga, <b7_0>the great auk<b7_0/>, Steller's sea cow, <b11_0>the thylacine<b11_0/>, <b9_0>the bluebuck<b9_0/>, the Arabian oryx, the Caspian and Javan tigers, the markhor, the Sumatran rhinoceros, <b10_0>the bison<b10_0/>, the North American cougar, the <b8_0>Altai argali sheep<b8_0/>, the Asian elephant and many more, <a2_0>primarily for commercial sale or sport.<a2_0/> All these animals have been hunted <a3_0>to endangerment or extinction<a3_0/>.
